citation.article-title: Mycoplasma testudineum sp. nov., from a desert tortoise (Gopherus agassizii) with upper respiratory tract disease
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Mycoplasma testudineum sp. nov.
Mycoplasma testudineum (tes.tu.din′e.um. L. neut. adj. testudineum of or belonging to a tortoise).
Cells predominantly coccoid in shape, varying from 200 to 800 nm in diameter.
Cells devoid of cell wall and surrounded only by cytoplasmic membrane.
Colonies on solid medium with 0·8 % agar exhibit typical fried-egg forms.
Does not hydrolyse arginine or urea.
Serum or sterol required for sustained growth.
Serologically distinct from all other recognized Mycoplasma species.
First isolated from the upper respiratory tract of a free-ranging desert tortoise (Gopherus agassizii) in the Mojave Desert.
Its 16S rRNA gene sequence is unique (GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession no. AY366210).
